item.title: Senior Manager- Venture Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager- Venture Analytics

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of organization – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives. We are building a world class team focused on creating new experiences, exploring new business models and developing new relationships that add value to how people live and work. 

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members to find innovative solutions.

What is the opportunity?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.

  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.

  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modeling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.

  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

 

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must Have:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).

  • 3+ years of SQL (for analyses & creating reports) with additional experience in predictive analytics (R, Python, etc.).

  • Experience with complex, large-scale relational databases, and statistical programs, with an aptitude to adapt and implement additional technical applications or tools

  • Experience managing data tools/platforms and hosting team-based knowledge sharing sessions

  • Proven track record of communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.

  • Ability to inform and influence stakeholders cross-functionally through data, building relationships, while communicating early and often

  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.
     

Nice to Have:

  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a big plus.

  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)
     

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits

  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

 RBCVentures

 #LI-Hybrid

item.title: Director, IA Analytics Ecosystem
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, IA Analytics Ecosystem

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Director, IA Analytic Ecosystem, you will be accountable for the development of data products and services that span across all platforms in Internal Audit. The role creates new and innovative ways to leverage data across all of RBC’s businesses for new opportunities.  The role defines, supports and informs business strategies through the breakdown, analysis and understanding of vast amounts of data, both internal and external to RBC.  Provides engagement and leadership to a development team so they can deliver big data solutions for critical applications and regulatory requirements. Interacts with senior leaders to ensure that business value is being generated from the set of enterprise data services that the director is responsible for.


The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?  

  • Strong Collaboration and Stakeholder management. Partner with Internal Audit Product Owners and Data Leads to understand business objectives and technology requirements in order to lead, support and recommend solutions that add business value, both current and future
  • Lead and execute Proof of Concept (POC) for new technologies and present feedback, recommendation and/or final decisions
  • Lead and evolve Audit Data Domain custodianship through automation for data catalogue, data lineage and data quality  integration with CDO data governance platform
  • Lead the upkeep and maintenance of the Ecosystem infrastructure, analytics process and ensuring technology currency
  • Develop new and evolve current analytics capabilities and standards to ensure efficiencies and effectiveness in IA data management and analytics practice.
  • Lead and actively pursue innovation and ideation. Present opportunities and proposed architecture to senior leadership and lead the build out of those opportunities.
  • Lead and actively pursue automation opportunities to drive Audit efficiencies
  • Demonstrate leadership presence: Establish credibility by demonstrating subject matter expertise and knowledge in process excellence, be confident, authentic and effective, respect diversity and coach others, connect and engage stakeholders, build rapport, build strong relationships subject matter experts

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have 

  • Undergraduate degree    (e.g. B.Com., B. Math, P. Eng., MSc (Data Science)
  • Extensive experience in a big data environment with a focus on end to end medium/large project development
  • Exceptional development expertise using Python/APIs/JS/HTML/DAO
  • Exceptional knowledge of Database technologies SQL. Hadoop and Data Engineering tools e.g. Dataiku, Data stage and Data Visualization tools e.g. Tableau
  • Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).
  • Undergraduate STEM degree (e.g. B.Sc, P. Eng.)

Nice-to-have 

  • Post-Graduate coursework e.g., (MSc in Data Science)
  • Functional knowledge of Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python)
  • A good sense of UX/UI design and visualization for translating business user stories to working prototypes with HTML5/CSS,Plot.ly ,D3 JavaScript libraries

What’s in it for you? This is standard

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make lasting through Business value generation

item.title: Manager, Reporting and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As Manager, Analytics and Reporting is responsible for the execution of a data and analytics strategy that delivers key insights in alignment with the function’s goals. You will leverages expertise in business strategy, analytics, data science, and visualization techniques to further enable risk-based reporting by identifying credit risks in the various global and U.S. credit portfolios. You wil also be accountable for the implementation of reporting and analytics that will provide continuous improvements to Credit Risk Review and IA Wholesale Credit Risk teams.

Maintains an awareness of and ongoing assessment of common technology practices, to ensure business value is generated from technology solutions, which serves to enhance 3rd line level of assurance and insights. Recommend use of technology for continued enhancement of internal practices to improve levels of efficiency and exploration of expansion of technology capabilities to strengthen transaction and portfolio analysis. Leverages expertise in analytics, data science, and visualization techniques to further enable risk-based reporting by identifying credit risks in the various global and U.S. credit portfolios.

What will you do?

  • Execute all foundational data & analytics initiatives that support all U.S. Credit Risk Review workflows including Target Reviews, Continuous Monitoring Reviews, Risk Assessments, Regulatory, Internal Senior Management and Board Committee reporting
  • Extract, transform, and load client/loan data from Credit Client Management System (CCMS), Newton and other related systems in order to provide updated credit portfolio data to the U.S. CRR team members
  • Assist in the implementation / recommendation of new data analytics and enhanced reporting in support of review planning and execution
  • Assist in the implementation / recommendation of new automation opportunities to create efficiencies 
  • Ensure Metric Stream is maintained for any applicable U.S. CRR activities (e.g. issue tracking)
  • Strong and committed team player, having the ability to deal with the changing needs of the function through effective teamwork and communication; Manage personal skill development by planning future career growth; Participate in cross-training initiatives
  • Work closely with Internal Audit (IA) credit teams (e.g. Wholesale Credit and Credit Risk CoE) to assist in data & analytics initiatives that support wholesale, commercial, wealth management, and retail credit audits.
  • Collaborate with the Internal Audit Data Management & Analytic team to gain insights from the use of data analytics across the audit function.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • university, or post-graduate degree in Computer Science, Analytics, Finance, Economics, Engineering or Math
  • Exceptional experience in data analytics cycle (ETL, data modeling, analytics, and reporting)
  • Proficient in Python, SQL , Data visualization and reporting – e.g. Tableau, Excel

Nice-to-have

  • Experience working with a credit risk review/credit or loan approval function within a Financial Institution
  • Experience in an Internal Audit function (ideally within a Financial Institution)
  • Experience with Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python) and associated tools ( e.g. RStudio and/or Jupyter) a plus
  • 2+ years’ experience working as a Business / Technical Systems Analyst in a highly analytical environment

What’s in it for you?    

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

CFG Sales Strategy and Analytics

Job Description

  • Assist with the development and implementation of customer account plans and strategies

  • Assist with implementing best practices to support consistent, consultative sales and client success processes
  • Assist with monitoring KPIs and sales metrics
  • Collaborate with business management, technology, finance, data management teams to develop bespoke reporting and dashboards
  • Gather data quickly and respond in oral and written format to senior sales people and client info requests
  • Interface with internal groups to organize meetings and coordinate presentation material content
  • Conduct on-going sales opportunity analysis
  • Work to ensure sales feedback is incorporated into reporting
  • Record client activities and opportunities in CRM systems
  • Assist in preparing periodic business updates for review with senior management.
  • Work collaboratively with partners within RBC to meet clients’ needs and objectives

Job Summary

Support the Central Funding sales organization across client facing verticals and work in partnership with Capital Markets businesses and Functions to achieve our strategic objectives. RBC Capital Market’s Central Funding Group (“CFG”) operates a global secured finance business providing short-term funding secured by collateral - typically fixed income and equity securities.

The role covers a broad range of activities/ responsibilities to support senior sales efforts, including the production of marketing material, preparing material for client meetings (internal and external), developing account plans and tracking follow ups to ensure client success.

item.title: Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What will you do?​

  • Develop and maintain origination pricing strategies for Unsecured Lines of Credit, Education Financing and Installment loans to ensure an optimal balance between profitability and acquisition volumes
  • Identify and execute on price optimization opportunities for revolving credit product portfolios to achieve profitability targets and improve KPIs.
  • Monitor competitor activity and develop benchmarking to inform pricing strategies.
  • Work closely with partner groups to manage the pricing lifecycle (strategy, execution, performance monitoring and refinement) for all PL products
  • Support the analytics needs of the PL business, including developing a deeper understanding of segment economics and customer behaviour, support for business cases, deep dives on new product innovation and special projects
  • Provide ad hoc analysis with actionable insights to enable strategic, fact-based discussions and facilitate better decision-making within PL

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have

  • 3+ years related work experience developing pricing and financial modelling
  • Programming experience to extract data and complete complex analytics. SAS / SQL required. R, Python, etc. preferred
  • Strategic mindset and ability to own the development and execution of pricing strategies and playbooks
  • Ability to demonstrate proficiency for critical thinking and analytics
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Nice-To-Have

  • Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a quantitative field is preferred but not required (e.g. Business, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, etc.)
  • Previous experience in a Finance role (Corporate Treasury, Funds Transfer Pricing)
  • Credit fundamentals including risk modeling and credit strategy development
  • Subject matter expertise on developing price sensitivity and propensity models

Job Summary

As the Senior Manager, Pricing and Analytics, you will be responsible for the development and management of pricing strategies to drive profitable growth and increased market share for the Personal Lending (PL) portfolios. The Senior Manager of Pricing and Analytics is responsible for the development and end-to-end implementation of pricing strategies, including providing actionable insights and recommendations to senior leadership to drive growth and profitability.

item.title: Senior Manager - Distribution Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager - Distribution Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In alignment with RBC’s collective ambition to “Win as One RBC”, the role of the Senior Manager – Distribution Analytics supports the Senior Director – Distribution Analytics in their ability to execute P&CB Regional Banking strategy and drive achievement of in-year objectives.

The Distribution Analytics team collaborates with product/channel groups, Regional Banking leaders and teams across Canadian Banking National Office to help drive business results by providing relevant and timely analysis and insights supporting both Retail and Business areas. You will work directly with Regional Banking leadership to develop, design, implement and manage a portfolio of analysis to support transformation initiatives by leveraging RBC’s suite of analytical tools. In addition, you will also deliver insights to help guide and shape strategic choices across the Regional Banking ecosystem, deliver ad-hoc analytics, and be a subject matter data expert (including leveraging data partnerships across multiple teams).

What will you do?

  • Drive business results by informing and influencing business strategies through the application of data analytics to drive insights. Collaborate with regions, business lines and channel partners to ensure optimization and strategic insights from analysis and data are applied to evolve Regional Banking channel and business strategies.  Strategies impacted can range from routine performance reporting to transformational initiatives impacting our banking ecosystem.  Leverage financial acumen to provide transparency and connectivity from activities to financial outcomes.
  • Deliver complete, accurate and timely Regional Banking analytics by channel, role, product, and region that enable the business to meet their short and long term goals.
  • Interact with senior business and regional leadership to understand business and Regional Banking objectives, in order to define and perform analytics to meet those objectives.
  • Responsibility for end-to-end analysis including framing and negotiating analytical objectives with senior leaders, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.
  • Respond to ad-hoc reports needed for effective management support and oversight.
  • Investigate available predictive models and segmentation techniques to improve Regional Banking analytics across role, channel, product and region.
  • Review and support business cases and develop analysis plans to ensure analytical requirements are captured and analytical objectives are well understood and meaningful.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 5+ years of experience with big data, sales, distribution, financials, business analytics or related roles
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills; Attention to detail, organization, ability to multi task and time management is critical
  • Outstanding business and financial acumen with strong analytical, communication and presentation skills; including the ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Strategic mindset – considerable amount of creative, innovative and analytical thinking, ability to conceptualize strategy, and strong problem solving required
  • Experience in the application of statistical/visualization tools coupled with strong technical skills in (SAS, SQL, Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint) will be preferred capabilities

Nice to have:

  • Familiar with a range of statistical data tools - strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining. (Python, R) preferred but not required.
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of retail and commercial roles, incentive, sales, distribution, and finance is preferred
  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline preferred but not required

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics will implement stress testing components and participate in risk management analytics and processes to minimize credit risk. The ideal candidate will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

What will you do?

  • Identify ECL production challenges and conducts independent problem solving to resolve proficiently.
  • Communicate results and analyses to management and key stakeholders.

Must Have:

  • Experience with SAS & Python programming
  • Experience with data analytics
  • Knowledge of credit products in the financial industry

Nice-to-Have:

item.title: Manager, Data Analytics, HR Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics, HR Governance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Manager, Data Analytics, HR Governance position will coordinate and manage data-related requirements within the HR Governance team. You will be a subject matter expert regarding data and data analysis and will maintain accurate data relating to regulatory requirements (such as SMCR and Whistleblowing) and provide accurate, user-friendly MI for senior management forums. You will utilise data and data analytics expertise to provide advice on, and implement, enhancements to how data is stored, maintained, updated and reported on.

What will you do?

Whistleblowing and Retaliation Monitoring

  • Regular and ad-hoc reporting and data analysis requirements, this will include quarterly reports to HRC and SMFs, grievances and retaliation monitoring, quarterly analysis of new and emerging trends on employee concerns for WBC and Trend Analysis Forum, quarterly reports to Enterprise ER on cases and retaliation monitoring
  • Routine retaliation monitoring, including bi-weekly monitoring of leavers, redundancies, PIPs and disciplinaries, monthly monitoring of changes to reporting lines, job mandates and remuneration, year-end monitoring of performance ratings (YoY and peer group comparison), monthly retaliation monitoring report for Head of HR and Whistleblowing Champion
  • Monitoring completion of online training for people managers
  • Bi-weekly testing of the WB reporting line
  • Monitoring of implementation of recommendations made as part of investigations

Senior Manager & Certification Regime (SMCR)

  • Assistance with Workday design/implementation relating to SMCR requirements
  • Regular auditing of data changes (made by other HR Governance team members) within a variety of systems to ensure accuracy
  • Weekly Business Manager attestation process to capture changes to SMCR population, and upload of changes to FCA Register
  • Monthly reporting and data analysis for SMCR Management Committee and SMCR Oversight Forum
  • Super-user for Trailight tool to make system changes and updates
  • Manage 30 day travel process to identify potential overseas visitors who are in scope for SMCR
  • Assistance with year-end Annual F&P review and MiFID K&C reviews including monitoring of, and reporting on, completion of various elements of the F&P process (self-attestations, manager attestations, background screening) and issuing annual F&P certificates
  • Review and approve regulated background screening reports
  • Monthly mapping of SMF\'s and other regulatory roles

HR Department Risk

  • BCP
  • Tracking audit points & other recommendations/improvements

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Proven experience of data analytics in a regulated environment
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Proven ability to present data in an attractive and user-friendly way, including advanced PowerPoint skills

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of local regulations, such as SMCR and Whistleblowing
  • Knowledge and experience of databases such as Tableau, Workday and ADP

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics

Job Description

  • Define testing scope and methodology using a risk-based approach against data sets/portfolios, data sources/systems, reporting elements, and data infrastructure components
  • Engage with stakeholders to gather information required in defining testing cycles and engagement model 
  • Create repeatable documented test scripts and maintain them accordingly
  • Define data testing automation requirements and engage with technology partners for tool selection and use
  • Document data testing procedures and controls including identifying the entrance and exit criteria of key processes and classifying risk and controls accordingly as well as reporting self-identified findings and remediating them
  • Execute data testing procedures and test scripts including identifying root cause of issues and grouping them into themes
  • Produce test results memo including clearly articulating test results, summarizing key findings and issues and communicate the data testing story to stakeholders
  • Engage stakeholders to solicit their remediation plans and validate that remediation plans are sustainable
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve and optimize the data quality assurance processes including recommending analytical tools and training courses
  • Contributes content for the development of training materials
  • Conduct knowledge sharing sessions amongst staff within the Enterprise Chief Data Office and participate in key events and meetings
  • Promote the value of data quality assurance & analytics services to key stakeholders across the bank and establish strong and trusted relationships
  • Prepare and contribute materials required for regulatory and internal audit exams as required
  • Escalate operational risks and issues and control deficiencies that you identify in your line of work to your line manager on a timely basis

Job Summary

•The Senior Manager, Data Quality Assurance & Analytics is responsible for conducting the independent validation over the accuracy and integrity of data throughout the data supply chain that supports the firm’s key business processes such as regulatory reporting and critical management reporting. This entails performing data analysis and transaction testing using analytical tools to address key risks associated with the data sets and data infrastructure.

•The Senior Manager position is an individual contributor role within the Data Quality Assurance & Analytics function of the Enterprise Data Governance Operations (EDGO) of the Chief Data Office (CDO). The EDGO functions as a ‘Second Line of Defense’ within RBC’s ‘Three Lines of Defense’ model, accountable for managing the firm’s information management risk in support of RBC’s operational risk management objectives. The Senior Manager position reports to the Director of Data Quality Assurance & Analytics.

item.title: Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?  

In this role as a Senior Manager, Marketing Mix Modelling & Analytics, you will leverage analytics skills, design and implement data science solutions to solve a broad range of marketing business use cases related to marketing spend optimization. By collaborating with business, marketing, analytics & technology partners, you will take full advantage of large data sets to explore and discover new insights and opportunities that would have not been possible with traditional analytics. Our vision is to improve the way we measure marketing investments, and to help the organization evolve the decisioning and planning strategy for marketing mix.

What will you do?

  • Develop RBC Marketing Mix Modelling strategy, scaling resources, tools, and processes to provide solutions that align to business needs that are actionable with a tangible outcome. Work closely with key marketing and business partners and influence key stakeholders.
  • Collect and validate data from various sources, and prepare structured/non-structured data for modelling by cleaning, integrating and transforming large datasets
  • Develop and deploy statistical and machine learning models using Python and R
  • Translate model outputs and leverage visualization tools/packages to story-tell and convey data-driven insights with actionable recommendations to key stakeholders
  • Research, explore, and prototype future non-standard analytics approaches that push the current limits by quickly learning emerging methods/tools from research communities and further exploring public and vendor data

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have  

  • Bachelors or Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or other quantitative discipline
  • 3+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive analytics and statistical modelling with a focus on driving business impact
  • Strong Python/R skills for model preparation and development
  • Proficiency with SQL is required and experience working with cloud environments would be a plus
  • Familiarity with scenario planning for optimization or forecasting
  • Experience of visualizing and presenting data and analytics findings to executives
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, time management and communication skills
  • Self-motivation, creativity and ability to work independently


 

Nice to have:

  • Previous experience with marketing and media analytics, including attribution and marketing mix modelling
  • Familiarity with marketing metrics and analyzing data for digital marketing as well as all other non-digital channel marketing
  • Experience working in financial industry with understanding of bank products and data
  • Experience with natural language processing / text mining or competitive market analysis

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.description:

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title

Vice President, Portfolio Governance & Analytics (Capital Markets)

Job Description

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Improve executive insights into emerging project risks through better portfolio reporting and by establishing new governance meetings

  • Guide the project/portfolio planning, monitoring and controls function, including intake of new proposals and execution of the triage, prioritization and approval processes to move projects through the Investment Review Board and Project Approval Meetings

  • Act as a liaison between business departments and Technology by educating stakeholders about planning practices and regularly identifying areas for improvement

  • Lead the quality assurance program and routing of Project Change Requests (PCRs)

  • Position the PM CoE as a trusted partner by striving for excellence and communicating with conviction

  • Develop new processes, standards, best practices, tools and techniques using a risk-based approach in partnership with the CM PMO.

  • Maintain a strong understanding of the PMO landscape in RBC and ensure the Capital Markets COO group is represented accurately in target operating models

  • Produce program portfolio status reporting and at the Executive level to ensure goals and objectives are clearly and consistently communicated across all teams

  • Analyze project and portfolio data, develop metrics & benchmarks, and provide insightful and accurate reporting to support management decisions

  • Drive the development of dashboards to highlight trends, changes and potential risks/issues in the portfolio.

  • Develop and coach junior staff to deliver against business priorities

Must Have:

  • University degree or equivalent experience

  • Over 10 years experience in the following:

  • Understanding of data management practices

  • Project Management, Business Analyst methodology, Risk Management, Audit and/or Financial Services industry

  • Resource management

  • Negotiation, facilitation and presentation skills with strong experience preparing PowerPoint decks

  • Expert level communication skills both written and verbal

  • Ability to manage and coordinate across numerous stakeholders in various areas of the organization

  • Comfort with analysis and analytical processes and basic tools such as Excel, Tableau, SharePoint, Confluence, JIRA

  • Quality control

  • Cost / Benefit analysis and alternative identification

  • Conflicts and issues resolution and escalation

Nice to Have :

The Business Transformation group is dedicated to enabling business opportunities through collaboration and delivery excellence of strategic Capital Markets initiatives.

item.title: Associate - Market Data Solutions
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate - Market Data Solutions

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

This position supports the market data needs for RBC Financial Group globally, including providing solutions and reviewing existing tools (and their associated costs). Market data provides the tools for revenue generation in multiple RBC businesses. For most RBC Enterprise businesses, market data is a critical dependency for revenue generation. Business partners are a demanding group of investment and risk management professionals who depend on timely and accurate market information for effective decision making. The role requires an astute business advisor and diplomat who understands not only the data, but also the business lines being served.

What will you do?

Contract Management

  • Become the global Market Data relationship manager, managing market data related contracts and negotiating best terms during contract reviews/new initiatives with savings and cost avoidance in mind.

Business Engagement

  • Become the key stakeholder to the global RBC Market Data user community, supporting all  platforms on their Market data requirements
  • Collaborate with various internal RBC groups and peers to identify improvements or alternative approaches, and provide leadership on best practices and options on Market Data services

Supplier Management/Vendor Engagement

  • Engage with market data suppliers on a regular basis to review market data requirements, issues, changes, updates, etc.
  • Coordinate meetings or be an escalation point for Market Data Suppliers and the RBC Stakeholders
  • Ensure all market data suppliers adhere to internal supplier management and business continuity requirements; also ensuring all documents and related internal systems are updated accordingly; can involve working with various internal groups (ie Legal, Finance, Functions, etc)

Analytics/Reporting

  • Produce ad-hoc, monthly and quarterly detailed reporting/presentation decks with valued added commentary, analysis and metrics point of escalation/reference for the business line problems

Product Research/Industry Intelligence

  • Seek out sources and solutions for market data strategy per RBC business requirements
  • Research industry trends and provide guidance on alternative solutions or changes impacting market data. Participate in industry working groups to lobby for consistent policies across data provider community
  • Evaluate and review new market data products and providing recommendations on services or solutions for RBC Enterprise

What you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • University degree/MBA
  • 5+ years’ experience in a technology/financial services environment
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills
  • Advance proficiency in Excel, Word, and Powerpoint

Nice to-have

  • High level understanding of Market Data tools (MDM, FITS or similar) and control mechanisms (DACS, DART, EMRS) an asset.
  • Data Analysis

item.title: Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Regional Banking Support’s BFS Reporting is hiring a Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management role that will support strategic reporting and visual insights for Regional Banking’s BFS by successfully transforming data into useful, relevant information, and by leveraging sound business knowledge, additional sources of information, and resources to deliver insight to the BFS field.  The position plays a role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders in a BFS banking environment, alongside key technology partners. 

What will you do?

  • Utilize cutting edge business intelligence capabilities to optimize business results, define, measure, and deliver insights and mitigate risk.

  • Design and develop/enhance innovative reporting solutions to monitor performance management, present key analytical and business insights to underlying drivers in support of the BFS advisors and leaders on client and coaching insights to drive an exceptional client experience.

  • Take end to end responsibility in the development and enhancement of performance metrics and reporting in Tableau.

  • Respond to ad-hoc investigations, inquiries, data, and report requests as assigned.

  • Run production jobs as assigned.

  • Demonstrate Subject Matter Expertise in data and reporting infrastructure design, configuration and optimization, providing recommendations on approach and execution.

  • Apply standard design principles and data visualization techniques to measure key indicators, disclose trends, provide proactive actionable insights/indicators and address business questions.

  • Identify appropriate data sources and perform Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) for data modelling, data quality assessments, understand patterns and provide the basis to inform the reporting solution which provides meaningful performance management insights.

  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand their business strategies (role design, incentive, practice management and portfolio quality) and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction.

  • Participate in design and solution review demonstrations with the Senior Manager and/or internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications.

  • Test and validate (QA) new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements.

  • Enhance and optimize existing production processes.  

  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases.

  • Be a thought partner within the BFS Reporting team, supporting the developments of insights, processes, data approaches/ methodologies and information that is valued by partners across Regional Banking and BFS.

  • Learn on a consistent basis, be adaptable to change due to re-prioritizing of items.

       

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent related experience.

  • Working experience in both SAS and Tableau.

  • Demonstrated ETL and big data modeling capabilities, with programming experience in large databases/datasets and using SAS, SQL Server and Teradata SQL Assistant.

  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining.

  • Proficient in SQL extracts in order to investigate data from data warehouse and other sources (flat files) for investigation/analysis purposes.

  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders in order to inform of strategic decisions.

  • Proven quantitative analytical (including data knowledge, data discovery, data aggregation and summarization) and problem solving skills.

  • UNIX knowledge (i.e. submit process, create logs, store data).

  • Advanced in developing reports using Tableau.

  • Data knowledge on RBC’s EDW.

  • Be skilled in Microsoft applications (Excel, PowerPoint).

  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience.

Nice-to-have

  • Financial Services Industry/Business Financial Services knowledge

  • Experience in developing performance metrics/reports

  • Programming/coding skills in Python and Hadoop (HIVE) and Datameer

  • Experience with Tableau Security, Tableau Server Administration

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Bilingual Claims Specialist
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Bilingual Claims Specialist

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

In this role you will adjudicate and manage Life and waiver claims in a team-oriented, multi-disciplinary, digital environment.  You will be responsible for applying appropriate risk management strategies, which will impact on the company’s financial results, reputation and regulatory risks, client relationships, and business retention.

What will you do? 

• Responsible for the bilingual (French and English) adjudication of claims utilizing a multidisciplinary claim management model to:

- ensure objective, fair and thorough claim adjudication

- comply with practices and procedures and regulatory requirements

- provide the highest level of customer service and manage reputational risk

- develop and implement claims management and return to work strategies on their assigned caseloads where warranted

• Assess, research and analyze numerous contracts, documents the appropriate next steps while effectively and professionally communicating outcomes to our clients

• Effectively communicate and build rapport with team members, stakeholders and business partners using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close

• Resolve minor conflicts and issues and escalates to others as appropriate

What will you need to succeed? 

• Post secondary education

• Minimum 1 year previous Life claims experience

• Strong analytical and decision making skills

• Ability to multitask and balance multiple goals and priorities

• Excellent oral and written communication skills in both English and French

• Demonstrated ability to effectively deal with customers in a manner that is professional with a high degree of customer service

• Ability to effectively manage change

Special Conditions

Please note you must be fluently bilingual in both English and French to apply.  Only applicants fluent in both languages will be considered for this position.

What\'s in it for you?

• A Total Rewards program that includes flexible benefits, work/life balance and career development programs and investment and retirement savings plans

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

• Flexible work/life balance options

• Sophisticated RBCI software tools to boost your productivity

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Job Title

Associate Director, Liquidity Risk Measurement

Job Description

What Will You Do?

  • Analyzing and processing data, building and maintaining models and report templates, and developing dynamic, data-driven solutions.

  • Consulting on using business intelligence data for predictive analytics and facilitating implementation of new tools.

  • Recommending appropriate performance measures to be produced including lifts, efficiencies, confidence intervals, and other statistical metrics.

The Associate Director, Liquidity Risk Measurement will be responsible to provide business and technical expertise for the analytics process, tools and applications for a business function or business unit as well as applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Manager, AML Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, AML Data Management

Job Description

 

 WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?  

The AML Data Management team is mandated to execute the Enterprise AML and Financial Crimes Data Management Program that will govern data used within the enterprise to meet regulatory requirements and expectations, while accommodating RBC’s innovation framework.  You will contribute to sustaining and enhancing the oversight and governance of data used within key processes of the AML and Financial Crimes (such as sanctions screening and transaction monitoring).  You will have an opportunity to liaise with AML Compliance, AML FIU, the Chief Data Office, DNA, and other business partners to execute data management strategies and protocols to maintain and enhance an effective and efficient AML and Financial Crimes Program at RBC.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?  

  • Analyze large data sets in conjunction with data dictionaries, system documentation, and end user documentation to understand business context and translate into data requirements from an enterprise AML Program perspective
  • Perform data profiling and analysis of data sources to assess data availability and ensure AML data requirements are continually satisfied
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis to measure data quality in accordance with the CDO data quality strategy. Define data quality rules and scorecards for ongoing monitoring and measurement of data quality, particularly from an AML Program perspective
  • Evaluate data quality measurements and scorecards to identify data quality issues that may impact the effectiveness of the AML Program. Leverage enterprise data governance tools to document detailed data lineage and data transformations through liaison between business stakeholders and IT partners
  • Perform post implementation verification to ensure AML data requirements from data sources have been accurately and successfully captured in target data models/schemas
  • Assist with the development of high level plans and user stories for completion of AML data requirements and acceptance phases of projects, improving in the level of detail and accuracy of estimates over time

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have

  • Undergraduate degree coupled with change management experience in complex programs with high frequency of requests and multiple priorities
  • 5+ years of technical experience using SQL to interface with various databases, data sources, and file systems (RBDMS, OLTP/OLAP, flat files, UNIX, HDFS)
  • Understanding of data governance and data quality concepts and processes such as Data Quality Controls, Authoritative Data Sources, Master and Reference Data, etc.
  • Proficient with SAS programming and its macro language to perform quantitative data analysis and transformations.  Other expertise with R, Hadoop, VBA, Java and C++  or other related experience desirable
  • Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of reconciliation design, data integration, data sourcing, data quality reporting, and exception resolution processes. As well as knowledge of data warehousing, front-to-back data flows and processing in banking database systems
  • Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers
  • Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
  • Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) designation or other related certifications

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Senior Data Analyst (IAM) (GCS)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Analyst (IAM) (GCS)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of RBC’s digital transformation the Identity & Access Management (IAM) team is building out a data analytics & identity governance pillar with the mandate to consolidate, cleanse, govern, and enrich our IAM data to make strong data driven strategic decisions.  The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible to build and maintain the analytics model using RBC’s analytics tools, support the ongoing evolution of the IAM Data Analytics function, including finding new and innovative insights from existing or potential data sources, and identification of new opportunities to strengthen governance processes and reduce risk.

What will you do?

  • Develop and lead the requirements gathering, documentation, data capture, and analysis processes in partnership with stakeholders
  • Leverage visualization dashboard to present data-driven insights and actionable recommendations, ensuring that the information is easily understood and interpreted.
  • Conduct exploratory analysis and interpretation of new and different data sources to identify valuable and innovative insights.
  • Work with teams across IAM and the enterprise, to find new opportunities to strengthen reporting and challenge existing analytics & governance models
  • Provide guidance, feedback, coaching, and mentoring to build the capabilities of other Data Analyst(s) on the team

What do you need to succeed?

  • 4+ years of experience performing common extract, transform, load (ETL) operations on structured datasets
  • 1-2 years of experience with data visualization/business insights tools, such as Tableau
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Experience with requirements gathering and documentation
  • Experience with programming and scripting languages (eg. Python, SQL)
  • Understanding of data management practices and data pipelines
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in team Leadership and mentoring
  • Strong Excel and powerpoint skills
  • Experience working with big data tools/solutions

What’s in it for you?

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Associate Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology

What will you do?

  • Participate in design sessions to provide input, gather and document requirements, and help formulate analytical frameworks to develop effective risk model reporting that creates robust business intelligence

  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon Quarterly Monitoring and regulatory reporting processes and data

  • Lead, as a subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities (activities include, but are not limited to data analysis, aggregation, interpretation and recommendation)

  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization

  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data & analytical methodology 

  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to

  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies

  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders

Must-have

  • Strong business and data acumen

  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights

  • At least 3 years working experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data

  • Advanced SQL programming and experience in SAS or similar tools; expertise with MS Office Suite.

  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with data management and data visualization using tools including Tableau

  • Strong data manipulation capability using financial formulas

 Nice-to-have

  • Experience in the Financial industry

  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. Job Summary

The Associate Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology will lead the development of RBC’s Retail and Wholesale AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters.

As an Associated Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology you will focus on model development, back-testing and the quality of data ingested for modeling credit risk parameters, PD, LGD and EAD. You will assist the Director, Credit Modeling & Methodology in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring.  You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters. 

The team has significant impact across the bank and continuous interactions with other groups and stakeholders, including Senior Management and regulators.

item.title: Senior Officer, Data Management (Fixed Term Contract)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Officer, Data Management (Fixed Term Contract)

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

During this 12 month fixed term contract you will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained
  • Assist with Data Management tasks and projects as directed by Senior Associates, Manager of the Data Management team and the Manager of Data Standards & Control.
  • Collaborate with colleagues to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner
  • Assist with the timely completion of Data Remediation projects.

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

item.title: Senior Investment Data Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Investment Data Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Data Governance Office (DGO) at RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) is accountable for implementing and maintaining GAM’s Data Management Program. The DGO has authority over the governance of all information at GAM and the obligation to create and enforce standards, set rules and establish policies on data creation, integration, and consumption.

In your role as Senior Data Analyst, you’ll be responsible for data driven business analysis, data maintenance and management of complex data flows. You will identify and collect data sources, analyze and extract key data and information, evaluate and monitor data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. You will also develop data policies and provide consistent improvement of data quality and transparency.

What will you do?

  • Maintain and enrich RBC Global Asset Management’s data warehouse working with all of RBC Global Asset Management’s investment groups. This would include security classification, analytics and reference data.
  • Work in conjunction with team members to ensure data standards are defined and enforced
  • Collaborate with internal clients  to identify, document and source data
  • Support initiatives and project implementations
  • Document business and technical processes
  • Develop toolsets and methods to improve data quality and availability
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • A working experience of 3-5 years in the investment data space
  • Demonstrated ability to understand data relationships, aggregate information and utilize SQL or other querying languages to research data issues
  • Experience verifying security data using sources such as Bloomberg, Yield Book, Factset, Ratings Agencies, and/or others
  • Operational understanding of fixed income, equity and derivative securities
  • Ability to translate business requirements into data requirements

Nice to Have

  • Investment operations, compliance or back-office experience
  • Ability to set priorities and work effectively in a fast paced, deadline oriented environment. Strong follow-through skills
  • Ability to be able to think creatively and use ‘out of the box’ solutions where possible.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.


RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Associate Director, Model Development and Implementation
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Model Development and Implementation

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Associate Director, Model Development and Implementation is responsible for developing the risk library related to market risk and counterparty credit risk, with applications to both strategic initiatives and Business As Usual (BAU) risk management.

You will also be responsible for developing specification, implementation, application support and maintenance.

What will you do?

  • Develop and maintain risk library in Python to cover all asset classes (interest rate, equity, credit, FX and commodity) in the trading portfolio for market risk, counterparty credit risk and CCAR.
  • Be proficient with key risk features of the products and risk factor identification process in the trading portfolio
  • Transform the representation of the risk measures and scenarios to estimate risk profit & loss
  • Work with risk and technology partners for data solutions, risk methodology and adopting industrial standard in application design/development
  • Integrate the risk model library with the overall enterprise architecture to provide end to end solution
  • Study & apply the distributed computation with focus on Spark framework
  • Initiate independent research projects to explore better tools and practice to gain efficiency

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have 

  • 2+ years of working experience in regulatory & internal risk management requirements under market risk, CCAR or counterparty credit risk. Preferred Quantitative modeling skill with risk focus IT development experience
  • Strong Python development skills with focus on finance use cases
  • Masters in Financial, Engineering, Statistics or equivalent. PhD in Finance, Engineering or Applied Sciences 
  • Above average oral and written presentation skills: ability to present clearly complicated modelling concepts and techniques to senior management
  • Broad knowledge across capital market products and business

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of C++ or other similar programming language

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

FX Quantitative Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be working in a fast-paced, active trading environment with front office deadlines. You will join the FX Quant team to develop new FX derivative products, improve FX valuation models and create analysis tools for the trading desk. You will work closely with multiple stakeholders like FX Trading and Sales, Structuring, Global Market Risk and Technology.  

What will you do?

  • Research, develop and implement mathematical models to calculate the value and risk of FX products (cash and derivative);
  • Improve existing pricing models, tools and operational frameworks;
  • Support ad-hoc requests for quantitative tools and analysis from the FX trading and sales desks;
  • Document products and models;
  • Work closely with risk and control functions to achieve and maintain formal validation of models for official reporting.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Post-graduate degree in a quantitative area such as mathematics, physics, finance, engineering or computer science;
  • Strong numerical and analytical programming skills in C++;
  • Knowledge of FX products;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • The ability to approach novel problems systematically and with tenacity. 

Nice-to-have   

  • A PhD in a quantitative discipline;
  • Knowledge of Python;
  • Exposure to a front office trading environment
