item.title: Associate Director, Credit Provisioning
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Credit Provisioning

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Credit Provision Analysis and Measurement (CPAM) team provides Senior Management within Risk Management, Finance, Business units ( i.e. Capital Markets, Canadian Banking, I&TS, Wealth Management, Insurance, and legal entities) and Investor Relations with expert analysis and guidance on the Banks allowance for credit loss (ACL) and provisions for credit losses (PCL).  

As the Associate Director you will be the subject matter expert on ACL/PCL for performing loans, interacting with model development teams, credit risk experts to understand drivers of changes in ACL and provide valued analysis. 

What will you do?

  • Prepare RBC’s credit provisioning analysis (both retail and wholesale) and reports (including inputs to enterprise/segment financial outlooks/plans) and communicate results to stakeholders.
  • Work with measurement, reporting and modeling team members to understand the assumptions used in calculation and reporting of credit provisioning, analyse results and help troubleshoot and resolve issues affecting the production of reporting responsibilities.
  • Maintain strong communication with functional and business partners for timely identification and escalation of issues affecting credit provisioning results.
  • Assist the Director in providing business and risk subject matter content and analysis for communication on credit impairment issues and information. Prepare reports for internal and external review and challenge.
  • Develop requisite processes and maintain up to date documentation for auditors and investor relations.
  • Comply with all bank policies including SOX controls as appropriate.
  • Support GRM-Enterprise Risk’s broader mandate in articulating RBC’s risk appetite, setting limits, and carrying out enterprise-wide stress testing, as related to loan portfolio analytics.
  • Keep abreast of macroeconomic, regulatory, accounting and other financial industry developments as they relate to RBC\'s credit provisioning (both wholesale and retail).

. 

What do you need to succeed?

  • 5+ years of work experience and understanding of banking and risk knowledge (wholesale or retail credit or both), with cross-functional capability Risk and Finance.  Educated to degree level in an analytical discipline such as Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics; or a combination of a quantitative undergraduate degree combined with an MBA.
  • Strong ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts in non-technical terms to business segment Finance and senior business segment leaders.
  • Demonstrated self-starter who can tailor analysis to required level of precision (i.e. identify 80/20 answers),
  • Works well with cross-functional teams (Risk, Finance), demonstrating strong teamwork, coordination, and people skills.
  • Ability to develop and / or maintain a strong network of internal and external relationships to facilitate credit impairment decisioning.

Nice-to-have    

  • Quick learner with outstanding conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills, with an ability to deliver under pressure.
  • A thorough understanding of relevant accounting and regulatory rules and requirements (IFRS 9, Basel) preferred.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

Job Summary

The Associate Director, Credit Provisioning will be a subject matter expert on ACL/PCL for performing loans, interacting with model development teams, credit risk experts to understand drivers of changes in ACL and provide valued analysis.

item.title: Director - Credit Provisioning Analysis and Measurement
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director - Credit Provisioning Analysis and Measurement

Job Description

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage RBC’s credit provisioning analysis (both retail and wholesale), reporting (including input to enterprise/segment financial forecast/plan), and communication function under IFRS 9, meeting the needs of internal and external stakeholders.

  • Work with the credit provision modeling and methodology teams to understand credit provision results and assumptions, provide subject matter content for ongoing enhancement of the methodologies in use.

  • Lead the effort around the analytics in support of the incremental scenario level analysis within the team and conduct adhoc analysis to support credit provisioning decisions.

  • Maintain strong communication with functional and business partners for timely identification and escalation of issues affecting credit provisioning results.

  • Provide business and risk subject matter content and analysis for communication on credit impairment issues and information.

  • Engage appropriate functional and business committees and partners; and enhance credit provisioning analytics to inform portfolio decisioning at enterprise level.

  • Ensure requisite processes are maintained and their execution adequately documented, with internal management and / or SOX controls as appropriate.

  • Support GRM-Enterprise Risk’s broader mandate in articulating RBC’s risk appetite, setting limits, and carrying out enterprise-wide stress testing, as related to loan portfolio analytics.

  • Keep abreast of macroeconomic, regulatory, accounting and other financial industry developments as they relate to RBC\'s credit provisioning (both wholesale and retail).

Managerial excellence

  • Understand RBC vision, as well as support and reinforce targeted behaviors that contribute to RBC goals.

  • Provide focus and clarity in establishing individual goals, driving performance management, and supporting career development.

  • Leverage the value in unit, department, and enterprise wide teams to develop better solutions and achieve a cross enterprise mindset.

Authorities, Impact, Risk

  • Critical to the implementation and continued enhancement of RBC\'s credit provisioning (under IFRS 9).

  • As a senior member of the CPAM group, engage other senior members of the team to build and maintain monthly execution/production of IFRS 9 provision, with enterprise and business segment PnL implications.

  • Deals with complex and material issues at enterprise level, with significant organizational impact (P&L, understanding portfolio dynamics and informing relevant portfolio decisioning)

Key Relationships

  • Risk Management and Finance executives (SVPs, VP) and senior committees (e,g. Allowance Committee)

  • Functional (Economics, Risk, Finance) and business (Capital Markets, Canadian Banking, Wealth Management, City National) leaders and teams.

  • Regulatory & supervisory authorities (e.g. OSFI, Bank of Canada), and external audit.

Must-Have

  • Strong banking and risk knowledge (wholesale or retail credit or both), with cross-functional capability Risk and Finance; minimum 8yrs+ work experience.

  • Strong quantitative understanding of credit models required, along with proficiency in programming (SAS/SQL/Python)

  • Graduate degree preferred in an analytical discipline such as Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics; or a combination of a quantitative undergraduate degree combined with an MBA, or CPA

  • Strong ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex concepts in non-technical terms to business segment Finance and senior business segment leaders.

  • Demonstrated self-starter who can tailor analysis to required level of precision (i.e. identify 80/20 answers).

  • Quick learner with outstanding conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills, with an ability to lead a team to work towards challenging deadlines and deliver under pressure.

  • Works well with cross-functional teams (Risk, Finance), demonstrating strong teamwork, coordination, and people skills.

  • Ability to develop and maintain a strong network of internal and external relationships to facilitate credit analysis decisioning.

  • A thorough understanding of relevant accounting and regulatory rules and requirements (IFRS 9, Basel) preferred.

Working Conditions (Legislative Requirement)

  • Standard office environment. Low-to-minimal travel.

  • Deadline pressures (committee presentations; internal and external submission requirements).

  • Combination of "high level conceptual" and "data intensive, detail oriented".

Time Allocation

  • 75% IFRS 9 execution and credit provision analytics, presentations, Risk / Finance / Business / Sr. Management interaction.

  • 25% People and Project Management; documentation, ad-hoc requests

Job Summary

The Director - Credit Provisioning Analysis and Measurement will be responsible to monitor market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market as well as applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization

item.title: Software Designer & Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Software Designer & Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC (Barbados) Service Company Limited has a vacancy for a Software Designer & Developer.  You will collaborate with IT, Operations and Business stakeholders to assess, research and resolve system issues and develop new technology solutions that meet sponsor/stakeholder needs.

What will you do?

  • Provide consulting services on new initiatives of small to large complexity
  • Assess, research and analyze business and system needs, exploring alternative options to recommend technology solutions and designs that meet sponsor needs and Product Lifecycle (PLC) deliverables including component reusability, data sharing and security
  • Prepare high level and detailed technical specifications in accordance with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), security and architecture documentation objectives
  • Contribute to successful project completion by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies
  • Provide input and co-ordinate with Data Engineers and Data Base Owner/Administrator (DBO/DBA) in creating new and modifying existing database structures using different types of databases and recommending and developing appropriate Graphical User Interface (GUI) designs based on required functionality
  • Be able to quickly, effectively and appropriately evaluate options, make decisions and execute within an intense high-tech environment
  • Coding, Testing & Documentation of in-house built applications and version control management
  • Develop, code, document and execute unit test, system, integration and acceptance test using different languages and testing tools for functions of high complexity

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical area of study (computer science, engineering, etc.) or other BS/BA degree with a concentration in computer science or information systems
  • Total IT experience of at least 7 years out of which 3 years doing solution architectures on at least medium sized projects
  • Proven experience at contributing to multiple projects from initiation to implementation
  • Database technologies – MS Access, DB2, SQL Server
  • Strong functional/object-oriented programing experience
  • Strong programming MS ACCESS with VBA coding and SQL in any RDBMS
  • CRM Tools: IBM App Connect, IBM Master Data Management, J2EE, Eclipse, Rational Application Developer Development environment
  • IT Standards, Methodologies, SDLC Information Security & audit requirements
  • Experience with data analytic tools
  • Experience with technical documentation (systems development and revisions.)

Nice to Have

  • Certifications in GUI programming languages, Relational Databases, Microsoft, Azure and SQL Server
  • Advance knowledge in SDLC, Data Management and Information flow

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Opportunity to do challenging work and make a difference with lasting impact
  • The advantage of working with a dynamic, collaborative, and high performing team where initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded
  • Leaders that support your development

Job Summary

Participates in the technical design, development, and implementation of application systems. Applies complete knowledge, skills, and practices to perform assignments.
